chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather D. Hediger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  
****May not have unsupervised contact w/ anyone under the age of 18.  No contact w/ Anthony Crutcher, Mr Brown, Mr Davis, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Follow all orders of the Department of Social Services, never physically or verbally discipline any child.  No contact w/ her children except at the request of the childrens treating professionals or the childrens adoptive parents and supervised by the DOC.

Court reporter transcript invoice for sentencing 7/15/15 paid by county $98.00
7/15/15 - Sentencing
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Masnica.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 30 years WSP; 20 years initial confinement w/credit for 386 days served; 10 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.
With ADA McNeill and Atty Masnica the SEH of 7/8/15 at 2pm is rescheduled, as victims foster parents are not available on that date; reset to 7/15/15 at 1:30pm.
With ADA McNeill and Atty Masnica by phone the court adjourns the SEH of 7/6/15 at 2:30pm, as Atty Masnica has not had opportunity to go over PSI w/deft yet; reset to 7/8/15 at 2pm.
5/18/15 - Status Hearing

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Masnica.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1, 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 7/6/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.
Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Masnica.  Clerk/H. Barnett.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Masnica.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Masnica states they are having ongoing negotiations.  STC continued to 5/18/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Masnica.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Due to a conflict w/the court's calendar the JS of 4/13/15 at 9am is rescheduled to 7/6/15 at 9am; JSH 6/10/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Status conference on March 3, 2015 at 08:45 am.
With Atty Masnica and ADA McNeill a STC is set for 3/3/15 at 8:45am to address status of case and adjournment of 4/13/15 trial date.

Judge Wilbur W Warren III, Acting Br. 6 today only.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Masnica.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State's motion for not contact order.  ADA McNeill states that after the offer was relayed new information was received that caused her to withdraw the offer and request a no contact order.  Atty Masnica objects to motion.  Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.
for no contact order while in custody; filed by ADA C McNeill.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Masnica.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victims family present.  Atty Masnica states that there is an offer and they intend to further negotiate.  JS set for 4/13/15 at 9am; JSH set for 1/23/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Judge Wilbur W Warren III, Acting Br. 6 today only.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty M Masnica appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Masnica reports that the State is still formulating an offer.  STC continued to 12/8/14 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With ADA McNeill and Atty Masnica the JS of 12/8/14 at 9am is removed from the calendar and the FPT on 11/17/14 at 1:30pm is changed to a STC.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
regarding use of videotaped statements.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Michael Masnica.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of not guilty entered.  D.A. Pretrial 9/19/14 at 1:30.  Judicial pretrial 11/17/14 at 1:30.  Jury selection 12/8/14 at 9:00.  Jury trial 12/9/14 at 9:00.  Motions to be filed by 11/17/14.  Defense motion to modify bond is denied.  Bond continued.
for modification of bail; filed by Atty M Masnica.

Cross-examination by Atty. Masnica. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 8-4-14 @ 8:15am. Information not filed. Bond continued.
